alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:55AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT, NORTHEASTERN DE BACA AND SOUTHWESTERN QUAY COUNTIES THROUGH 530 AM MDT... At 455 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Sumner Lake State Park, or 11 miles north of Fort Sumner, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... House. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
